item.title: 非上市股票交易的繁荣为印度带来财富和风险
item.description: 随着印度证券交易所的不断扩大，过去几年中造就了数十位亿万富翁，同时也出现了一个规模庞大、基本不受监管的非上市股票灰色市场。【原文：As India’s stock exchanges expand, minting dozens of billionaires over the past few years, a sprawling and largely unregulated gray market for unlisted shares has emerged.】

item.title: 如果特朗普颁布较温和的关税措施，亚洲债券将落后于新兴市场债券
item.description: 如果唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的关税政策最终比人们担心的要温和，亚洲新兴债券的价格将变得更加昂贵，使其吸引力低于全球同类债券。【原文：Emerging Asian bonds are turning more expensive, making them less attractive than their global peers if Donald Trump’s tariff policies turn out to be milder than feared.】

item.title: 中国新疆崛起为煤炭枢纽有损气候目标
item.description: 新疆西部地区正在成为中国煤炭生产的第四个枢纽，就在中国试图开始摆脱这种污染严重的燃料时，它创造了一个新的降价供应井。【原文：The western region of Xinjiang is emerging as a fourth hub for Chinese coal production, creating a new well of cut-price supply just as the country tries to start weaning itself off the heavily polluting fuel.】

item.title: 民进党官员表示日本央行加息不会破坏预算谈判
item.description: 日本首相石破茂的少数派政府需要一位反对党高级成员的支持，他表示，日本央行很可能不会突然改变政策，以至于破坏预算讨论。【原文：The Bank of Japan likely won’t change policy abruptly enough to derail budget discussions, according to a senior member of an opposition party whose support is needed by Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba’s minority government.】

item.title: 欧佩克+重要会议召开前，石油市场交投清淡，变动不大
item.description: 美国感恩节假期前，石油市场交投清淡，变化不大，市场焦点集中在本周末的欧佩克+会议上。【原文：Oil was little changed as trading thinned before the US Thanksgiving holiday, with the focus on this weekend’s OPEC+ meeting.】

item.title: 面对特朗普，墨西哥 2025 年的前景更加暗淡
item.description: 就在墨西哥总统克劳迪娅-希恩鲍姆试图平息人们对唐纳德-特朗普威胁征收 25% 关税的担忧之际，经济学家们却忧心忡忡地展望着，如果美国当选总统真的付诸实施，未来将面临的麻烦。【原文：Even as Mexico President Claudia Sheinbaum attempts to quell concerns over Donald Trump’s threat of 25% tariffs, economists are looking glumly at the trouble ahead should the US president-elect actually follow through.】

item.title: 澳大利亚中央银行改革在最后会谈中重启
item.description: 工党政府和左翼少数党绿党在最后一刻开始谈判，以重启陷入僵局的立法，此后，澳大利亚对储备银行进行彻底改革的计划（包括将现有董事会一分为二）可能会重新提上议事日程。【原文：Australia’s plans to overhaul the Reserve Bank, including splitting the current board in two, may be back on the agenda after the Labor government and minority left-wing Greens Party began last minute talks to revive the stalled legislation.】

item.title: Lombard Odier称购买中国刺激政策是 "痛苦的交易
item.description: 虽然中国的经济刺激政策给中国 10 万亿美元的股票市场带来了最初的欣喜，但对于 Lombard Odier 的亚洲投资总监来说，之后发生的事情却让他感到不安。【原文：While China’s stimulus blitz delivered initial euphoria to the nation’s $10 trillion stock market, for Lombard Odier’s Asia investment chief it’s what happened after that has him on edge.】

item.title: G1 称巴西将公布 120 亿美元的开支削减计划
item.description: 据巴西当地网站 G1 报道，巴西财政部长费尔南多-哈达德（Fernando Haddad）将公布一项寻求已久的计划，从公共开支中削减 700 亿雷亚尔（约合 118 亿美元），直至 2026 年。【原文：Brazil Finance Minister Fernando Haddad is set to unveil a long-sought plan to cut 70 billion reais ($11.8 billion) from public spending through 2026 as investors’ fiscal concerns sink assets from the currency to stocks, according to a report by local website G1.】

item.title: 新西兰填补职位减少表明失业率上升
item.description: 10 月份，新西兰的就业岗位连续第七个月减少，失业率上升的迹象更加明显。【原文：New Zealand filled jobs fell for a seventh straight month in October, adding to signs of rising unemployment.】

item.title: 美国债券收益率下降，日元因美元走强：市场综述
item.description: 在国债反弹对收益率和美元造成压力之后，日元走强削弱了周四的日本股票期货。美国股市在感恩节假期前下跌。【原文：A stronger yen weakened Japanese equity futures Thursday after a rally in Treasuries weighed on yields and the dollar. US stocks fell ahead of the Thanksgiving holiday.】

item.title: 克里希南将离开安德烈森，与马斯克商讨未来角色
item.description: 安德森-霍洛维茨公司（Andreessen Horowitz）的普通合伙人斯里拉姆-克里希南（Sriram Krishnan）即将离开这家风险投资公司，并已与埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）商讨加入其提高政府效率的工作。【原文：Andreessen Horowitz general partner Sriram Krishnan is leaving the venture capital firm, and has had discussions with Elon Musk about joining his efforts to improve government efficiency.】

item.title: 特朗普引发的比特币反弹对韩国小盘股来说是个坏消息
item.description: 自唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）最近赢得大选以来，比特币涨势迅猛，这给资本市场的一个偏远角落带来了压力：韩国的小盘股。【原文：Bitcoin’s breakneck rally since the recent election victory of Donald Trump is piling pressure on a far-flung corner of the capital markets: small cap stocks in South Korea.】

item.title: 墨西哥石油公司因供应商债务问题冻结与承包商的新合同
item.description: 墨西哥国家石油公司（Petroleos Mexicanos）正在冻结与服务供应商的新合同，因为该公司正努力偿还拖欠供应商的约 200 亿美元债务。【原文：Mexican state oil company Petroleos Mexicanos is putting a freeze on new contracts with service providers as the company works to pay off the roughly $20 billion it owes suppliers.】

item.title: 价格飙升，巴西咖啡出口商寻求债务重新谈判
item.description: 咖啡期货的上涨增加了市场运营的财务成本，促使世界头号咖啡供应国巴西的两家出口公司寻求债务重新谈判。【原文：A rally in coffee futures that’s increasing the financial cost of operating in the market has spurred two exporting companies in the world’s top supplier Brazil to seek debt renegotiation.】

item.title: Citadel 和 Pimco 将在精神航空破产后持有其股份
item.description: 肯-格里芬（Ken Griffin）的 Citadel Advisors 公司、太平洋投资管理公司（Pacific Investment Management Co.【原文：Ken Griffin’s Citadel Advisors, Pacific Investment Management Co. and Western Asset Management Co. are among the investment firms poised to own equity in Spirit Airlines Inc. after the budget carrier restructures its balance sheet in bankruptcy.】

item.title: 委内瑞拉债权人计划与埃利奥特争夺 Citgo
item.description: 至少有两家委内瑞拉债权人计划在法院下令进行的拍卖中竞购美国炼油商 Citgo Petroleum Corp. 的母公司，与埃利奥特投资管理公司（Elliott Investment Management）关联公司的出价竞争。【原文：At least two Venezuela creditors are planning to submit bids for US-based refiner Citgo Petroleum Corp.’s parent in a court-ordered auction, competing with an offer made by an affiliate of Elliott Investment Management.】

item.title: 亿万富翁萨利纳斯的 Elektra 公司呼吁股东将公司私有化
item.description: 亿万富翁里卡多-萨利纳斯-普利戈（Ricardo Salinas Pliego）拥有的墨西哥零售商埃莱克特拉集团（Grupo Elektra）已经启动了将公司私有化的程序。【原文：Mexican retailer Grupo Elektra, owned by billionaire Ricardo Salinas Pliego, has initiated the process to take the company private.】

item.title: 价值 1650 亿美元的房地产令日本企业备受瞩目
item.description: 全球对冲基金和私募股权投资公司正在向日本公司倾斜，以期释放价值被低估的高达 25 万亿日元（1,650 亿美元）的房地产。【原文：Global hedge funds and private equity firms are gravitating toward Japanese companies in a bid to unlock as much as ¥25 trillion ($165 billion) in undervalued real estate.】

item.title: 微软面临美国联邦贸易委员会的广泛反垄断调查
item.description: 美国联邦贸易委员会已对微软公司展开反垄断调查，调查范围从该公司的云计算和软件许可业务到网络安全产品和人工智能产品。【原文：The US Federal Trade Commission has opened an antitrust investigation of Microsoft Corp., drilling into everything from the company’s cloud computing and software licensing businesses to cybersecurity offerings and artificial intelligence products.】

item.title: 关于 WFH 和 RTO 规定的争论如何演变
item.description: 在 2020 年开始的大流行性停工期间，数百万上班族突然放弃工作场所，开始在家办公，麦肯锡公司研究员 Ryan Luby 称其为 "一次大规模的社会实验"。关于这场实验证明了什么的争论仍在继续。【原文：During the pandemic lockdowns that began in 2020, millions of office workers suddenly abandoned their workplaces and started doing their jobs from home in what McKinsey & Co. researcher Ryan Luby called “a social experiment at scale.” The debate over what it proved rages on.】

item.title: Checkr 收入增长三倍，背景调查公司赢得大型企业客户青睐
item.description: Checkr Group Inc. 是一家以筛选快递员和共享汽车司机起家的背景调查供应商，随着其客户群不断扩大，包括更多的大型企业，该公司的收入在两年内增长了两倍多。【原文：Checkr Group Inc., the background-check vendor that got its start screening couriers and rideshare drivers, has more than tripled its revenue in two years as its customer base has grown to include more large enterprises.】

item.title: 特拉菲古拉押注陷入困境的碳信用市场有望反弹
item.description: 大宗商品贸易巨头创辉集团（Trafigura Group）正在为陷入困境的碳信用额市场带来创纪录的增长做好准备，因为该集团押注新的监管框架将推动碳信用额工具成为排放核算的主流。【原文：Trafigura Group, the commodities trading giant, is positioning for record growth in the beleaguered market for carbon credits, as it bets new regulatory frameworks will propel the instruments into the mainstream of emissions accounting.】

item.title: 维旺迪称小投资者寻求推迟分拆投票
item.description: 维旺迪公司（Vivendi SE）称，投资者 CIAM 已向巴黎商事法院提出申请，要求推迟原定于下月召开的股东大会，并推迟拆分公司的计划。【原文：Vivendi SE said investor CIAM has filed with the Paris Commercial Court to postpone its shareholder meeting scheduled for next month and delay its plan to break up the company.】

item.title: 鲁比尼支持热门债券对冲特朗普引发的价格冲击
item.description: 努里埃尔-鲁比尼（Nouriel Roubini）正在为这样一个世界做准备：由于唐纳德-特朗普的政策议程，包括他对宽松货币政策和提高关税的支持，美国长期债券的收益率将走高，从而有可能削弱物价的稳定性。【原文：Nouriel Roubini is preparing for a world in which yields on long-dated US bonds will edge higher as Donald Trump’s policy agenda — including his support for looser monetary policy and higher tariffs — risks eroding price stability.】

item.title: 谷歌寻求挽回 Epic Games 在 Play 商店的反垄断胜利
item.description: Alphabet Inc.旗下的谷歌公司正在请求联邦上诉法院撤销对《堡垒之夜》（Fortnite）游戏制造商Epic Games提起的反垄断案的裁决，该裁决将迫使搜索巨头全面整改其Play移动应用商店。【原文：Alphabet Inc.’s Google is asking a federal appeals court to throw out a ruling in an antitrust case brought by Fortnite-maker Epic Games that would force the search giant to overhaul its Play mobile app store.】

item.title: Uber 因订阅问题面临 FTC 消费者保护调查
item.description: 美国联邦贸易委员会正在调查优步科技公司（Uber Technologies Inc.【原文：The US Federal Trade Commission is looking into whether Uber Technologies Inc. violated consumer protection laws with its flagship subscription service.】

item.title: 欧特克在 Starboard 施压后专注于削减成本
item.description: 欧特克公司（Autodesk Inc.首席执行官安德鲁-阿纳诺斯特（Andrew Anagnost）表示，公司正集中精力削减销售和营销团队的成本，此举是迫于激进投资者 Starboard Value LP 的压力。【原文：Autodesk Inc. Chief Executive Officer Andrew Anagnost said the company is focused on cutting costs in its sales and marketing teams, a move that comes following pressure from activist investor Starboard Value LP.】

item.title: 霍博肯称遭受网络攻击，服务暂停
item.description: 新泽西州霍博肯市表示，在遭受勒索软件攻击后，该市暂停了部分服务。【原文：The New Jersey city of Hoboken said it suspended some services after it was the victim of a ransomware attack.】

item.title: 特朗普胜选后中国出人意料地继续购买美国大豆
item.description: 中国仍在继续购买美国大豆，这让一些交易商感到困惑，他们曾预计在两国可能爆发贸易战之前，美国大豆的运输量会放缓。【原文：China is continuing to buy US soybeans, confounding some traders who had expected the flow of shipments to slow down ahead of a potential trade war between both countries.】
